Paper.Title: Ontology Model for Process Level Capabilities of Manufacturing Resources
Paper.Summary: This paper presents an ontology model to represent capabilities of manufacturing machine-tools at the process level. It uses a Basic Formal Ontology (BFO) foundation to semantically define process capabilities, resource behaviors, and integration in cloud manufacturing systems.
Paper.Reference: A. Sarkar and D. Šormaz, “Ontology Model for Process Level Capabilities of Manufacturing Resources,” in *2019 International Conference on Smart Manufacturing (ICSM)*, 2019, pp. 1–8.

Mapping.Notes: Useful for modelling machine-tool capability definitions inside AML and integrated CAEX structures.

Paper.Title: Dynamic Evaluation and Spatial Characteristics of Smart Manufacturing Capability in China
Paper.Authors: Jie Xue, Zhenyan Li, Xian Wang, Yanli Ji
Paper.Summary: This study evaluates smart manufacturing capability across 30 Chinese provinces (2014–2019). It uses an index system across environment, infrastructure, and industrial development supported by entropy weight, TOPSIS, and TOWA methodologies. Results show regional gradients and increasing spatial clustering.
Paper.Reference: J. Xue, Z. Li, X. Wang, and Y. Ji, “Dynamic Evaluation and Spatial Characteristics of Smart Manufacturing Capability in China,” *Complexity*, vol. 2022, pp. 1–16, 2022.

Mapping.Notes: Provides methodology foundations for quantitative capability assessment models we may integrate into the final Capability Framework.

Paper.Title: Resilience Thinking: Integrating Resilience, Adaptability and Transformability
Paper.Authors: Carl Folke, Stephen R. Carpenter, Brian Walker, Marten Scheffer, Terry Chapin, Johan Rockström
Paper.Summary: Foundational work that defines resilience, adaptability, and transformability in social–ecological systems. Explains multi-scale interactions, threshold behavior, and how transformations at smaller scales support long-term resilience.
Paper.Reference: YC. Folke, S. R. Carpenter, B. Walker, M. Scheffer, T. Chapin, and J. Rockström, “Resilience Thinking: Integrating Resilience, Adaptability and Transformability,” *Ecology and Society*, vol. 15, no. 4, p. 20, 2010.

Mapping.Notes: Forms the theoretical backbone for defining resilience attributes within the capability model.

Paper.Title: Product-Oriented Product-Process-Resource Asset Network and its Representation in AutomationML for Asset Administration Shell
Paper.Authors: Sára Strakošová, Petr Novák, Petr Kadera
Paper.Summary: This paper proposes a Product-Process-Resource (PPR) Asset Network model and its structured representation in AutomationML integrated with the Asset Administration Shell (AAS). Focuses on lifecycle management, mechatronics, EV engineering, and standard-based digital models.
Paper.Reference: YS. Strakošová, P. Novák, and P. Kadera, “Product-Oriented Product-Process-Resource Asset Network and its Representation in AutomationML for Asset Administration Shell,” in *2024 IEEE 29th International Conference on Emerging Technologies and Factory Automation (ETFA)*, 2024, pp. 1–8.

Mapping.Notes: This paper guides how to implement the capability model physically inside an AML/CAEX digital engineering environment.
